channel.name: Migrating to o1js gives error in Nextjs

messages.content:
I tried to migrate o1js from ^0.* to  ^1.0.*

Steps to reproduce:
- remove node_modules & package-lock file
- npm install
- npm run dev

error:
```
 тип ./contracts/Add.js:10:0
Module not found: Can't resolve 'o1js'
   8 |     if (typeof Reflect === "object" && typeof Reflect.metadata === "function") return Reflect.metadata(k, v);
   9 | };
> 10 | import { Field, SmartContract, state, State, method } from 'o1js';
  11 | /**
  12 |  * Basic Example
  13 |  * See https://docs.minaprotocol.com/zkapps for more info.
```

Nextjs version:
14.1.4

It works fine when I reinstall 0.* version
First I got an error to import o1js, I need to remove the webpack part in next.config.js.

Hi. I've been struggling with this error too and came across this thread.

> I need to remove the webpack part in next.config.js.

I tried this and it worked fine. Thank you 😄

Interesting, I'm glad you figured this out!
Fyi @ymekuria
Thanks for flagging this. We need to update the next.config to be compatible with all the o1js changes and next 14.

any updates on that ?  @ymekuria 
I'm having hard days and just unsure if that's me or something to do with latest version

current error whenever I try to import my contracts

```ModuleParseError: Module parse failed: Unexpected token (15:7)
You may need an appropriate loader to handle this file type, currently no loaders are configured to process this file. See https://webpack.js.org/concepts#loaders
| import { FungibleTokenLike } from './FungibleTokenLike';
| 
> export interface FungibleTokenDeployProps
|   extends Exclude<DeployArgs, undefined> {
|   /** The initial administrator of the token contract. */```
Can you share your next.config

:p_pepe_sad: 
it's been nearly 2 weeks, I'd prefer to use both latest next and o1js
did anyone managed to create working next.js config ?
@zkKirol yes please
Are you having some sort of issues here

Mmm, I was able to use Next with the last o1js version setting basically the same configuration (reactStrictMode set to true tho):

https://github.com/chrlyz/wrdhom_client/blob/main/next.config.js

embeds.title: wrdhom_client/next.config.js at main ┬╖ chrlyz/wrdhom_client
embeds.description: Client for WrdHom: the auditable social-media platform - chrlyz/wrdhom_client

messages.content: I think Kracked is a bot btw, @Moderator

Me too, he has been dispatched 🙂

Thanks for reporting.

ahhhhhh you configuration is different as you're using npm package for your contracts! 
I should have tried that before! 

@taka @Youtpout @IaM [ZK] <DEV> if you run `npm pack` in your contract folder and import the .tgz as dependency in package.json of client it should work

I guess it makes sense as npm then is packing it all.

Did you solve it eventually? encountering exactly same problem, made a basic project and peer dependency from contract build seems not to work, keep getting "Can't resolve 'o1js'" from the zkAppWorkerClient
you mean, import the tgz from the UI?

Import contract as npm dependency but instead of version number just paste path to tgz

Or you can just publish it up to npm registry
I will downgrade o1js to 0.16.2... hopefully that will work
Ok, I confirm that `o1js 1.1.0` is causing module not found in the imported contract build loaded from the zkAppWorker and downgrading to `o1js 0.16.2` seems to be fixing it.
Have you tried updating typescript? https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/1237299723732385844/1240709846731456594

solution to use o1js 1.1.0 with latest next 
- remove webpack o1js part from next. config.js
- run npm pack in your contract folder and import the .tgz as dependency in package.json 
- upgrading  typescript version "^5.4.3"
annoying delays with @renzokuken at zkHack
Because with this we simply restore the entry point of previous `o1js` versions: https://github.com/o1-labs/o1js/commit/0a56798210e9e6678a2b18ca0cecd683b05ba6e5

For the "use server" modules, I do not have a working config, as I always receive the error.
```
Error: ENOENT: no such file or directory, open '/Users/mike/Documents/DeFi/MinaNFT/Tests/ui/mint-test/.next/server/vendor-chunks/plonk_wasm_bg.wasm'
```
but I don't think that it is important as next.js vercel servers are limited to 2 CPUs and 3 GB of memory, so it is better not to use them for o1js workers and go for more powerful workers.
Yeah we have it in pr with fix, thank you, it will be landed soon

Important update: https://discord.com/channels/484437221055922177/1278727250572873729/1280877515669504042
https://github.com/o1-labs/zkapp-cli/pull/693
